name: Generative AI APIs
description: Generative AI and Large Language Models (LLMs) are transforming how we build applications. In this topic, you'll learn how to integrate LLM APIs into your Python applications. These skills are essential for modern cloud engineering as AI services are becoming core components of cloud platforms.

learning_steps.description:
Before coding, understand these core concepts:

- Messages format: LLMs work with conversation-style inputs (system, user, assistant messages)
- Completions: The API generates text based on your input
- Parameters: temperature (0 = deterministic, 1 = creative), max_tokens (response length), model (which LLM version)
- Structured outputs: Getting JSON instead of free text

learning_steps.title: Python OpenAI Demos
learning_steps.description: Start with this free hands-on practice using GitHub Models. This repository teaches you the OpenAI Python SDK through progressively complex examplesâ€”the same SDK used by Azure OpenAI. You can run it completely free using GitHub Models in GitHub Codespaces.

1. Chat Completions - Start with chat.py, then try chat_stream.py and chat_history.py
2. Structured Outputs - Learn to get JSON responses with structured_outputs_basic.py
3. Function Calling - See how LLMs can call your code with function_calling_basic.py
Once you've completed the demos, apply your skills to your cloud provider's AI service:

options.title: Azure OpenAI Chat Completions Quickstart
options.description: If you're focusing on Azure (accessed via Azure AI Foundry)

options.title: AWS Bedrock Getting Started
options.description: If you're focusing on AWS (supports Claude, Llama, and other models)

options.title: Vertex AI Generative AI Overview
options.description: If you're focusing on Google Cloud (supports Gemini and other models)

learning_steps.description:
IMPORTANT: Test prompts in your provider's web interface before writing code. Try these exercises:

1. Simple completion: 'Analyze the sentiment of this text: I learned so much today!'
2. Structured output: Request JSON with sentiment and summary fields
3. System message test: Add a system message that sets a 'learning coach' persona
Create a simple Python script llm_test.py that loads API credentials from environment variables, sends a journal entry to the LLM, requests sentiment analysis, and prints the results.
